variables.name: Stress CPU
variables.description: This will activate only CPU stress. This will add the argument (--cpu)

variables.name: CPU + RAM Stress
variables.description: This will activate the argument (--vm) + (--vm-bytes). Disable CPU Stress for this to work correctly.

variables.name: CPU Cores
variables.description: How many cores do you want to stress?

variables.name: RAM Memory
variables.description: Enter here in MB, how much RAM will be stressed.

variables.name: Metrics
variables.description: enable metrics and show only non-zero results. (--metrics-brief)

variables.name: Execution Time
variables.description: Time the command will run in seconds. If not specified, it will run for 1 day (--timeout 30s)

variables.name: Use your own arguments?
variables.description: Enable the use of your own arguments

variables.name: Your Arguments
variables.description: If you want to add your own arguments, check the stress-ng Wiki: https://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/bionic/man1/stress-ng.1.html
